Governance allows the Vega network to ar: Governance allows the Vega network to arrive at on-chain decisions, where tokenholders can create proposals that other tokenholders can vote to approve or reject. This is how the protocol powers the creation of decentralised financial products.
Decisions on the Vega network are on-cha: Decisions on the Vega network are on-chain, with tokenholders creating proposals that other tokenholders vote to approve or reject.
Discuss governance, sense check and form: Discuss governance, sense check and formalise governance proposals for the Vega network.
Review and vote on governance proposals.
Read the docs to create and submit a pro: Read the docs to create and submit a proposal using Vega APIs.
And store in an Ethereum wallet. You can: And store in an Ethereum wallet. You can purchase VEGA using Ethereum (ETH) on decentralized exchanges.
A Vega wallet is used to access and sign: A Vega wallet is used to access and sign transactions and connect to any dApp running on Vega.
Note, you'll need some ETH to pay any tr: Note, you'll need some ETH to pay any transaction fees.
Start a topic and share an outline of yo: Start a topic and share an outline of your proposal on the forum with a 'sense-check' tag. Get an idea of whether there is support for your proposal from the likes and replies you receive, and refine your plans.
Start a topic on the forum: Start a topic on the forum
Update your proposal topic based on the: Update your proposal topic based on the feedback received, and ensure you have included the rationale and specifics of the proposed addition/change, including the data (JSON or similar) that would be submitted on chain. Update the tag and invite debate and discussion to amend the proposal until it reaches a final state, ready to submit.
Read the docs to make a proposal: Read the docs to make a proposal
As a token holder, you can submit the pr: As a token holder, you can submit the proposal using the command line to create a new market, change an existing market, change network parameters, add an external asset to Vega and make a freeform proposal (for changes that will not change network behaviour). For each, you will define specific inputs for a set list of parameters, which are validated by the nodes before entering into the voting period you set. Then it's time to rally the community on the forum to vote for your proposal.
Token holders consider and vote for or a: Token holders consider and vote for or against active proposals using the governance tools. Tokens used for voting are not locked or transferred - they can also be used for staking. Note, each public key with a minimum of 1 $VEGA gets just one vote per proposal.
If a proposal receives enough votes with: If a proposal receives enough votes within the enactment period, the change is automatically enacted (except for a free form proposal).
